basics.name: Rina Ogino
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences and a Minor in Japanese in the Department of East Asian Languages and Literatures at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

courses: ICS 222 - Basic Concepts of Computer Science

work.company: College of Natural Sciences Student Academic Success Center
highlights: Implement and maintain user-friendly website using HTML, send out weekly newsletters to expand available resources and opportunities for students
Design and publish 5+ weekly posts on social media, resulting in 78% outreach in span of one year
Manage and secure document processing with precise data entry while ensuring data confidentiality in compliance with FERPA
Lead project on Alumni Survey Analysis encompassing approximately 1200 responses, and identify key insights to present to the department for results in improving resource allocation
Implement 200+ books into the RFID system, streamlining book identification processes and enhancing library efficiency
Organize and rearrange bookshelves for optimal public access and usability
Deliver assistance to library users in navigating technology, guidance on device usage, and digital catalog access

awards.title: Charles R. Hemenway Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to undergraduate students with great weight in character and qualities of good citizenship, as well as academic merit, a minimum overall GPA of 3.0.

awards.title: W. Wesley and Hiromi Peterson Student Support Endowment
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to a student enrolled in a degree program in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawai'i at Manoa College of Natural Sciences for the purpose of encouraging and recognizing excellence in research and scholarship, a minimum overall GPA of 3.5.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.
